item.title: Music Overview
item.description: If you are shuttling kids around to lots of activities, online lessons would be a nice way to simplify your schedule. Or If music lessons are on pause due to Covid-19 going online might not be a bad way to ensure there is continuity in learning before things go back to normal. A nice article for those wondering when is a good time for kids to puck

item.title: LessonFace
item.description: Review Lessonface.com Offers live online music lessons to students of all ages and levels for most instruments. Teachers approved through background checks. Parent encouraged to “sit in” in person or on the web session. COPPA-compliant, parents to sign up for kids under 13. Juilliard-trained teachers can prepare high schools students for auditions. Its not cheap though. Group lessons available at lower cost.

item.title: TakeLessons
item.description: Website Take aways TakeLessons is a startup that connects students with pre-screened music teachers, academic tutors, dance, acting, and foreign language instructors locally and online. Might take some effort to find the right teacher. Some complaints about their billing, so be careful.

item.title: Thumbtack
item.description: Take Aways Website Music lessons in real time, with a live coach. Parents can signup and choosing an instrument; The Find Teacher feature allows searching teachers by price range, availability, location etc. Video program is downloaded that helps video conference with the teacher in real time. 30-60 minute lessons

item.title: Youtube
item.description: Take Aways Website Some of the best first steps to take in learning music is free lessons on youtube (without a doubt) Some kids feel very comfortable being able to skip back / replay videos and learn at their pace Some of the coaches use online platforms for 1-1 lessons and this helps children warn up to the coach by following their lessons on youtube first.
